Business and Management

Business Management is one of the core modules of the University of London International Foundation Programme (IFP). It introduces students to the essential concepts, theories, and practices that underpin how businesses operate in local, national, and global contexts. The module explores the role of managers in planning, decision-making, and strategy, while also considering the responsibilities businesses hold towards stakeholders, society, and the environment. The module also develops transferable skills in research, writing, and communication. Through a combination of lectures, tutorials, formative tests, and a mock examination, students will be supported in preparing for the final written examination. By engaging fully with the module, students will gain a deeper understanding of how businesses make decisions and how these decisions impact both performance and wider society.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Identify basic business structures and their functions.

+  Identify risk and major changes in the external business environment and assess the impact of these on business.

+  Analyse and discuss how managements make their choices regarding strategies and the theoretical models that help these to be implemented succesfully.

+  Analyse and discuss ways by which businesses can pursue their aims and objectives with effective management of resources including marketing, human resource management, finance and IT.

+  Provide a business critique of contemporary events, review the options available and recommend actions.
